favourite.article: Jesus Lord I am captured by Your beauty! My heart is open to You Lord. Oh Lord You are so lovely, so precious to me! All my self love, every thing is displeasing to me. You alone Lord are my satisfaction.
Dearest Lord, I waste myself upon Thee; Loving Thee, I’m deeply satisfied.
Lord loves me so much and takes care of me and my family. I love Jesus more than my life. Since I thought about Lord I got bless.
Dearest Lord, I waste myself upon Thee; Loving Thee, I’m deeply satisfied.
Oh not alone do I adore Thee! Oh Lord I'm captured by Thy beauty! How I yearn to see Thee face to face! Oh dear saints we give our all to Him!
Quickly come, our love is waiting for Thee; Jesus Lord, Thou wilt be satisfied. I just love You Lord!!!
Saturate me, Lord, I now implore Thee, Mingle now Thy Spirit, Lord, with mine!

Lord, as I’m gazing here upon Thy glory, Fill my heart with radiancy divine; Saturate me, Lord, I now implore Thee, Mingle now Thy Spirit, Lord, with mine. Lord, when first I saw Thee in Thy splendor, All self-love and glory sank in shame; Now my heart its love and praises render, Tasting all the sweetness of Thy name. Dearest Lord, I waste myself upon Thee; Loving Thee, I’m deeply satisfied. Love outpoured from hidden depths within me, Costly oil, dear Lord, I would provide.
Amen, this is my favorite hymn. The whole song gives me a feeling over my body that is awesome. How precious You are, Lord.

Lord Jesus, dearest Lord how we yearn for more of Thee. We refuse to have nothing else but You. Lord we want to come back to our first love. Oh Lord Jesus save us moment by moment. We refuse to go back. We never go back to Babylon. O Lord we want to have a more subjective experience of You. The pathway may be drear but Lord we accept and move on only through You. Lord Jesus we cry out to You because we need You. You give us the radiancy to shine. You empower us to live a normal life. We are not alone, we have the Body, the saints, our dear brothers and sisters. Lord Jesus we yearn to see Thee face to face. We recognize our offering is not adequate, but Lord accept our offering.

I'm 13 and I really enjoy this song because it really gets me thinking about how I'm so captured by God's beauty. I love God so much and I really hope more people come to God and be saved because in the end we will be in the New Jerusalem. God I love You!!!

Hallelujah for such a hymn! Christ is so precious that we'd pour everything to anoint Him and we're breaking our flasks of alabasters, love from hidden depths within us are outpoured to the Lord. Loving Thee, I'm deeply satisfied!
If ever anything in this whole world becomes too difficult for you, SING THIS SONG! POUR it out on the head to our Master as costly oil...He will be satisfied (and you also).

If you mean every word while you sing this prayer, then you can't be the same person after the last verse...the pauses in between is just enough to lift up your eyes an to look into Jesus' eyes...O THIS song is written for ME to enjoy and I would like to share it with all my brothers and sisters...What is there in life that is SO special and So valuable to you? Bring it in your alabater flask and break the flask and anoint the Head of our master with the oil in it...He'll be satisfied! Be assured!
What a wonderful prayer to sing...

This hymn shows how the beginning of love in us toward the Lord is a vision of His wonderful person. I especially enjoy the part in stanza 2 that says, "Lord when first I saw Thee in Thy splendor...Now my heart its love and praises render." It's only by seeing the excellency of Christ that we can love Him, even with the best love.

I sing now every morning...I think it is WINDOWS. I have an old computur and really there is no way how I can stop the previous song but "to embed" the song and then I type another new song in. Can you perhaps introduce a way how you can stop the music, otherwise it just go on and on. I enjoy it out of my heart.
It has the key qualities in a beautiful hymn. Beautiful message, beautiful melody. Extremely well-written.
Amen. Yes, dear Lord, quickly come because we are waiting for You. Amen.
Yes, I like this song because I am a man who is captured by the love of God. Let the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ dwell in us. In Christ.
Not alone, O Lord, do I adore Thee, But with all the saints as Thy dear Bride. It was so sweet singing this hymn with all the dear saints in Jacksonville!

There is a saying, a very simple one and yet profound and it goes like this "He who has not Loved, Has not lived"' When I sing this song, to me a prayer, I am subdued by the One, who Loved the greatest, with the sole desire that I may enter into that love, and Live!!!!! Yes live, and of a truth until you have tasted and seen that the Lord is Good, you have not lived.

Precious Lord, my flask of alabaster, Gladly now, I break in love for Thee. I anoint Thy head beloved master, Lord behold, I've saved the best for Thee. This song is so precious, we just need to love the Lord, and waste ourselves upon the One whom we love.
It tell all that's in my heart and it moves into my spirit and allows the spirit of the Lord to flow out and it allows me to realize the kingdom of the heavens. Amen.

What beauty captures the human heart? All of creation is only but a shadow of the great Creator, and even then, one cannot fully know him without His word and His light. This beauty that captivates us, moves us, and turns our gloom to song, is not outward physical beauty that we can see with our eyes, but our Lord Jesus. Look away unto Him – not with these human eyes that are so easily corrupted – but with the eyes of our human spirit.
A blind sister loved the Lord Jesus and pursued Him with her whole heart. She received treatment for her eyes and immediately gained her sight. Yet as soon she saw how terrible this world had corrupted from original creation, she sought for her blindness once more. A dear brother took a bus to reach a certain destination. As he sat on the bus, he saw many things pass by him outside the bus, and he grieved at the world situation. When he got off the bus at his stop, he realized, his spirit was dead, and he was full of the feeling of deadness.
This world has no true beauty to offer man. Temptations and traps laid by the evil One ensnare us and cause us to pursue earthly things. We are often drawn away and drift from Him who saved us. Yet, if we pray for the Lord for blessed blindness, if we glance at the Savior, if we simply turn to Him, all other things fade away. Nothing can come in comparison to his beauty; we must believe this.
Generations of brothers and sisters who followed the Lord throughout Church history have “wasted” their lives before the Lord. Those in the world see such sacrifice as a waste of golden futures and prosperous riches. These ones, who “waste” their lives away to seek the Lord, drawn by his beauty, who pursue him, these are the ones who have laid for themselves treasures in the heavens. Like them, I want to “waste” myself upon the Lord. At first, it grieves me and causes me to weep to lose the things I hold on to in this world. But then, I realize, nothing I give to the Lord, my time, my belongings, my achievements, my heart is not a loss to me, but gains; It is a freedom and a joy to have the Lord alone. All I have, I offer to the Lord, knowing it is nothing, expecting nothing in return except for the Lord Himself to saturate and fill my entire being.

This song is my favorite. Every time singing it makes me satisfied, brings me to this lovely Person-Jesus. Jesus loves me without measurement, how could I measure the depth of His love! just stop everything to enjoy Him. this love is actually Himself. The more love the more Christ Himself, I long to be immersed in this love forever. Lord Jesus, I love You! Nothing and no one in this universe is valuable to us to pay attention to. How much we need to be filled with You!
How Precious our Lord is... so much precious

A dear sister from our locality recently passed away, and this was one of her favorite songs. As we sang this song at her memorial service, I was overwhelmed by the love our dear sister had for the Lord and for the saints. This is song certainly her testimony. Oh, Lord Jesus! Not alone do I adore Thee, but with all the saints as Thy dear Bride! Lord Jesus, quickly come! Our love is waiting for Thee. And Thou wilt be satisfied!
Who could have written a song with such sweetness and experience of Christ? Brother Ron Kangas.

I love this song, because every time that I am lonely I remember that the Lord is still there for me. I am attracted by His beauty. And I want to love Him more. Singing this song can lift my spirit up to Him and through this somehow I feel that I can reach Him. It seems to me that He is touching my heart. I am really overjoyed when I remember this song. God bless you all, brothers and sisters!

This song is one of my favourite hymns. I find it so sweet and personal yet very much Body-oriented... The experience of Christ as such an attracting and beautiful One brings a lot more appreciation of this wonderful Person! He is the One to whom we are being attracted and drawn day by day as we go on enjoying Him in His sweetness. And He is the only One we seek after... What a precious and intimate Christ we have!!!

I am 12 years old and I like this song because it makes me feel great. I like it when I am in church and we (the church) get to sing 1159. It just brings joy to everyone in that room. The thing I like the most about this song is the words. I think the words make you relax.

Each time I sing this song, I'm once again captured by the beauty of the Lord and my love for Him is renewed. When I'm in love with the Lord, I feel like I can just open my whole heart to Him! I want to be constantly reminded about how great it is to love Him in such a pure way. Too many times, I get caught up in my mind and feel like I need to do many things for Him. But coming to this song I realize that sometimes I just need to forget about all religious duty and to just enjoy remaining in His presence each moment simply because He is such a wonderful Person and so worthy to be loved. Spontaneously, as I love Him, I am filled by Him and what He desires becomes so clear to me.
Matthew 5:8 says "Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God." Loving the Lord with a pure heart enables us to see Him clearly. It's so true that in my experience, when I love the Lord and care for His interest, the 'sky' above becomes so clear because I realize that He's the One on the throne, that He's sovereign and He's wise and as long as He's in control, everything will be all right. Furthermore, seeing this wonderful Person washes away all of my self. I can just praise Him because He's so wonderful and whenever something comes up, I just turn to Him by calling on His name, "O Lord Jesus!"
As our love for Him grows, He becomes so precious to us that we are willing to pour out so much on Him. Just like Mary who poured out costly ointment from an alabaster flask to anoint the Lord Jesus, we would be able to give up what is precious to us because we've realized that He's much better! In my experience this could be small things like our time and our education to consecrating our whole life to Him. The Lord is so lovely and so worthy that the sacrifices we have to make are but small in comparison to the satisfaction we gain from loving Him.
Eventually, it will be our love for the Lord that will bring Him back. As lovers of the Lord, we are built up with the other saints to become the Bride of Christ. May He be satisfied with our love and what we have to offer to Him that He can come back quickly! "Dear Lord, draw us and attract us to Yourself each day. May we flee all youthful lusts and pursue righteousness, faith, love, peace with those who call on You out of a pure heart. We desire to love You with such a pure heart that satisfies your heart's desire and brings you back."
